topic: compiling rhdisp on Solaris with gcc?
body:
Hi!  


While I am trying to get the solaris build ready, I have one problem here
with  
Radiance 3.5, GCC 3.2.2 and Solaris 9:  the function disp_wait in rhdisp.c
gives 
me an error: 


gcc -I../common -L../lib -O3 -mcpu=v9 -mtune=v9 -m32 -DSPEED=200 
-ffast-math -Dlinux -L/usr/openwin/lib -I/usr/openwin/include -DNOSTEREO 
-DBIGMEM  -c  rhdisp.c 
rhdisp.c: In function `disp_wait': 
rhdisp.c:164: structure has no member named `_IO_read_end' 
rhdisp.c:164: structure has no member named `_IO_read_ptr' 
rhdisp.c:166: structure has no member named `_IO_read_end' 
rhdisp.c:166: structure has no member named `_IO_read_ptr' 
*** Error code 1 


Does anybody have an idea why I get this on Solaris? In fact, I have done
all 
gcc-compiles of Radiance 3.5 on 2.9.x-releases, and now I am using gcc3... 


All the rest compiles quite fine. (And I really want to get this new code
onto our 
ultrasparc machines ;-) 


CU Lars.
